channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes down Albert Road, 10th February
item.description:
The worst of the potholes are in between the two chicanes opposite the school but there is more damage on the road heading towards Cheltenham Town Centre
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes opened up AGAIN, 9th February
item.description:
Firstly these potholes need a proper fix , not patching up. Secondly, who is doing these repairs?? These holes are the sames one opening up over and over again. You (we the tax payers) are paying this company to re fill the same holes over and over again !! Who is reviewing their work ? And still alowing them to have the contract !? Their work is below expectations, and I'm sure not been done to a high enough standard.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole that is getting bigger, 9th February

On Shelley Road, at the entrance to Shelley Avenue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Shelley Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham

item.title: 12" pothole right outside my house, 9th February
item.description:
Just outside 14 Spring bank road cheltenham.this is causing structural damage to my house with buses smashing into every half hour.also the noise is keeping me awake at night and I am losing sleep.not impressed as this has been here for weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Springbank Road, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Outside No40 Malleson Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Castle Street, Winchcombe, 9th February
item.description:
I hope you may be able to help with a drain that has been blocked for several years by the back entrance/exit to Sudeley Castle at the junction between Castle Street, Rushley Lane and Sudeley Hill ///contain.strongman.towels This runs with water down hill towards Winchcombe for about six months of the year and has been pointed out to Highways but nothing has been done, although the drains above were repaired recently lower down the hill was omitted. In Winter the water frequently freezes and becomes a virtual Ski slope! Indeed the road was so dangerous last winter it was closed because of ice for a couple of days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castle Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
